title: Ian Ayre leaving Liverpool sooner than expected as Reds continue major reshape of Anfield hierarchy
text:
CLEAR OUT Ian Ayre leaving Liverpool sooner than expected as Reds continue major reshape of Anfield hierarchy 
Chief exec was due to leave in the summer but will now leave at the end of February By TOM SHEEN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LIVERPOOL chief executive Ian Ayre will leave his post four months early as the Reds continue their major reshaping of the club’s hierarchy. 
Ayre, who has been at the club in various posts since Tom Hicks and George Gillett took over the club in 2007, was supposed to leave in the summer. EPA Ian Ayre will leave Liverpool four months early as the Reds restructure their hierarchy Reuters Reds owner Tom Hicks made Ayre chief executive in 2014 
But, according to The Independent , Ayre will clear his desk at the end of February. 
The move was mutually agreed between Ayre and Fenway Sports Group president Mike Gordon, in order to allow two new figures to establish themselves in their roles. 
Billy Hogan will become Liverpool’s managing director – keeping his role as chief commercial officer – while Andy Hughes is now chief operating officer. The restructure means that Ayre’s replacement will have much fewer football responsibilities and will focus on the business side of the club. 
Ayre is set to move to 1860 Munich, although it is not clear when that will be. 
The German club, who are struggling in the second tier, have been bought by Jordanian billionaire Hasan Ismaik. AP:Associated Press 4 Ayre will now move to 1860 Munich – who have been bought by a Jordanian billionaire 
Ayre has been chief executive at Anfield since 2014 but has often been criticised for Liverpool’s struggles in the transfer market. 
He was also central to the ticket fiasco that saw a mass protest against Sunderland last February. 
But the local boy says he will leave the club “in much improved health” compared to when he started – just months after a second Champions League final in three years. 
A club statement also said: “Ayre has transformed and modernised the club, leading a complete overhaul of Liverpool’s financial, commercial and operational structure.” Klopp speaks his passion to official in Liverpool v Chelsea game
